news.title: The pivotal February jobs report is out Friday. Here's what to expect
news.summary: The BLS releases its February nonfarm payrolls report Friday. Markets will get another snapshot into the health of the labor market when the report is released.

news.title: Treasury Secretary Bessent says economy could be 'starting to roll a little bit'
news.summary: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin spoke about the U.S. economy and tariffs on "Squawk Box" Mnuchin also discussed the impact of tariffs on the economy.

news.title: Chipmakers are finding that good earnings aren't enough to please Wall Street
news.summary: Investors poured into semiconductor stocks last year, expectations are high, and companies are having trouble making Wall Street happy. Semiconductor companies are struggling to keep up with expectations.

news.title: Treasury Secretary Bessent says there's no Trump 'put,' but their policies should boost market
news.summary: Investors looking for Trump to use policy to stop the stock market from falling are likely to be disappointed, Bessent says. Bessen: "I don't think we're going to see a major policy shift in the near future"

news.title: Walgreens to go private in roughly $10 billion deal with Sycamore Partners
news.summary: The deal ends Walgreens' tumultuous run as a public company, which began in 1927. The historic transaction also ends the company's 100-year history as a publicly traded company.

news.title: JPMorgan is increasingly worried a second-half stock market rally won’t happen
news.summary: The bulls are getting nervous. The bulls are get nervous. It's time for the bulls to take a break from the bulls. It is time for a rest from the bull.

news.title: State Street’s private-debt ETF launched with major buzz. What are investors getting?
news.summary: A recently launched ETF actively managed by State Street Global Advisors has been drawing attention for bringing private credit to the masses. The fund is called the State Street Credit Opportunities Fund.

news.title: Nasdaq announces plans to launch 24-hour trading Monday through Friday
news.summary: Nasdaq Inc. announced the most ambitious plan yet by a major U.S. exchange operator to allow stocks to be traded around the clock.

news.title: Oil prices bounce, but head for weekly losses on tariff fears
news.summary: Russia’s deputy prime minister reportedly said OPEC+ could reverse its decision to begin increasing production next month if the market appears unbalanced.

news.title: This solid market indicator says to buy stocks now and enjoy double-digit gains
news.summary: The gold/platinum ratio has an impressive record. It’s turned bullish on U.S. equities. The ratio is currently at 1:1.
